website_summaries.verdict: With wireless connectivity and a curved design for a natural ergonomic position during typing, this model is a good option for users who need a basic ergonomic keyboard for occasional use.
pros: Users who only do occasional light typing or other infrequent work may find that this model best suits their needs
Wireless connectivity is easy to set up and reliable
Curved design keeps wrists in a natural, comfortable position when typing
Padded palm rest for additional comfort.This unit comes packaged with an ergonomically designed mouse
cons: Some of the action keys (like the "esc" and "fn" keys) are not in their traditional locations, causing users to stop and hunt for them when typing

customer_reviews.title: Horrible do not buy
customer_reviews.text: had it for a month. At first missing keystrokes but now completely disconnecting. Hopefully just a bad one and i can get an exchange. Update. Product is absolute garbage. I was issued an exchange and the same issues. random disconnecting and forget about typing in your windows log on. It will not catch the first key entered. I swapped in a cheap dell wireless keyboard and mouse and they work flawlessly. I disable the bluetooth sleep function too and the same issue. First time i have ever felt so compelled to write a bad review for something but i would hate for anyone else to waste money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from chicago

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I like how the keyboard feels from an ergonomic standpoint, however, after just 4 uses, neither the mouse or keyboard work anymore. USB device is no longer recognized by my PC. Update - I've only had this product for 5 weeks. Amazon will not allow a return, and Amazon support directed me to contact Microsoft for assistance. After literally 2 hours on the phone with MS support, they offered a replacement, and I have to pay to ship the faulty unit in. The box is roughly 30x3x9, it would cost me a fortune to box and ship from home. Seriously disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michi

customer_reviews.title: Believe the other reviews - stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE. I bought this keyboard on recommendation from my computer guy. It was really nice ... while it lasted. A little more than a month into using it, the keys suddenly stopped working half the time. I'd type, but only half the words would register. In looking for a solution online, I found all of the negative reviews here. Wish I'd taken the time to read them before buying. Sad to waste so much money. The mouse is still hanging in there though, as if that makes a difference. ~Renae
customer_reviews.author: Craig and Renae Gregoire

customer_reviews.title: Keypress is not consistent, easy to lose/miss keys.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this keyboard as a replacement for the Comfort Curve 2000 keyboard, which is my favorite keyboard of all time. I've worn many of them out, and they are no longer made. However, this keyboard consistently misses key presses. Consistently. Approximately 5% of typed keys don't actually get counted. I initially thought it was the signal to the wireless dongle, and it may be, but I've tried it in different USB slots, on a separate external hub, and on a different PC. All have the same issues. The keys are obnoxiously loud, too, for not being a mechanical keyboard, and there is the sound of the keys being depressed, but no output. It is frustrating. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this keyboard for 8 months. The reason I replaced my last keyboard is because the letters had worn off. I had my previous keyboard for years. The E, O, and S, are completely gone. A and D are almost gone. I like the battery life, haven't had to replace the batter yet. But the keys shouldn't disappear so quickly. I work from home so I use the keyboard every day. But, as much as I paid for this keyboard, the keys should still be visible!
customer_reviews.author: KPage

customer_reviews.title: It Ain't a 7000
customer_reviews.text: My Microsoft 7000 went toes-up and I needed a replacement. I loved my 7000 but Microsoft doesn't make that model anymore. I tried three or four other models before finally "settling" for this one. This model is curved but has no bulge in the middle allowing you to rotate your wrists outward. Also, the mouse is a bit squirrelly, really jumps around. This item isn't even close to a Microsoft 7000, but might be as close as you can get these days. I'd be willing to pay the higher price for a 7000, but I must be one of the few or they'd still be making them.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C. Nielsen, famous author

customer_reviews.title: Yes The Picture Shows A Curved Ergonomic Keyboard -- But....
customer_reviews.text: While there is nothing functionally wrong with this keyboard, I found that the actual angle between the two halves of the keyboard to be so small that it isn't all that much different from using a standard keyboard. Otherwise it's an excellent wireless keyboard and mouse with a single USB plug for the mouse and keyboard. Additionally, I'm a large man (6' 2" 220 Lbs.) so (at 19" wide) I found the keyboard a little hard to get used to particularly since I'm used to the 20" MS Natural Ergonomic keyboard. However, I've found the WIFI capability so far outweighs the limitations of the wider keyboard that it has been very much worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Simeon 'Sam'

customer_reviews.title: Have 2 of these now
customer_reviews.text: Have 1 at work and now another one for home office. Works perfectly. Might not be the most ergonomic, but comfortable to use, great price, and batteries last a really long time. My work combo is used 5 days a week, and keyboard batteries have lasted 12-16 months before needing to be changed. Mouse batteries last 8-12 months. Looks great. Keyboard is on the louder side (definitely louder than a laptop internal keyboard, but not the most noisy I've used).
customer_reviews.author: ayoa2

customer_reviews.title: Not so great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this keyboard I loved it, but after a year it is driving me crazy. The top row of keys make the computer crash and even harmless button likes Caps Lock do the same. My open programs will suddenly close and I get a pop up from the operation system of the computer saying the computer wants to shut down or re-start. Anybody else having this problem? Is there a solution or do I just have to buy a new keyboard?
customer_reviews.author: fishyks

customer_reviews.title: The things I dont like
customer_reviews.text: The only thing i don't like about this keyboard is the wrist rest. Its made out of a thin layer of rubber over plastic. I was hopeing for something more comfortable but its still a great keyboard. The keys are quiet and the range is great. I can type without error from about 15 feet away, yes i tested. The print screen button works, the top 2 levels of keys are mostly preset but can be adjusted to anything. Buy it and you won't be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: jack rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Defective Keys
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was a replacement for a Microsoft Model 5000 that I exchanged because letters on keys wore off very quickly. Same problem with this new model. I am a very proficient typist and don't look at the keys, but this should not be a consistent problem with a keyboard in this price range..
customer_reviews.author: lona

customer_reviews.title: keyboard pad and unit very slippery and mouse doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard pad is very hard & slippery and given the thickness of the keyboard, it is a position that your palms keep slipping off, which makes the keyboard slide away from you and you are constantly having to re-position the unit. The mouse cursor also moves a 1/4 to a 1/2 inch if you release the mouse which is very distracting going back and having to move the cursor back every time you use it. Finally the keyboard and mouse won't work well in a keyboard tray unless you attach the dongle to an extension and hang it under the desk surface as well.
customer_reviews.author: Force III

customer_reviews.title: Poor connectivity....really poor 2.5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today, and I don’t like it for one main reason: the receiver does not like to be plugged into a USB hub or docking station. The mice either won’t work and is jumpy making it impossible to control. Also, the keyboard has a very poor response time. The only way this product works is if you plug it directly into the laptop. Given the feel of the USB receiver, I don’t know if it’s design to take the stress of having to plug and unplug into a USB port daily. Very, very poor execution on Microsoft’s part. I’m not sure about keeping it now.
customer_reviews.author: NLVsd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ergonomic keyboard I've had. It is comfortable and there are no pesky wires that get in the way of my stand up desk. The wireless mouse is also very comfortable to use. An affordable buy for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Have bought many and will continue to!  Best keyboard out there!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many of these over the years. Bottom line they work and they last. I use a computer all day long. I eventually wear them out, then I buy another. I dont even look around. They are comfortable, they work and easily cleaned. I LOVE that there is a red light that comes on when battery gets low on mouse and keyboard. Keeps working long enough so you can go buy batteries and not just run out in the middle of something important! Personally there is no better keyboard. Its all I will buy till they don't make it anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: The Keyboard is great but the mouse stopped working and doesn't show any ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this a couple weeks ago and it was a replacement for Microsoft Keyboard/Mouse I had for a long time. The Keyboard is great but the mouse stopped working and doesn't show any sign of life. I am currently looking for a new mouse / keyboard and might have to look to someone other than Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Lockes

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'm not as happy with this as I thought I would be. Due to the hazards of ordering online. The mouse is larger than I like, and it has two side buttons that are far too easy to accidentally click. The keyboard's wedge shape is not like other ergonomic keyboards I've used before. The keys for options are in the wrong place and again it makes it easy to hit the wrong key and it throws you into something and your like what heck? Last lack of an easy instruction manual and drivers created a problem. It should ship with drivers and an easy 1,2,3 step instruction manual. I'm not using it. It's sitting on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Trammell

customer_reviews.title: Average quality but affordable unit
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard: Looks nice and feels nice. Easy to set up after you download the support programmes, for basic functions. It takes a bit of savvy to 'program' the buttons or add shortcuts. No status light for CAP key or any other key(s), however you could add a small Application, downloadable for free and get the status of the keyboard in the screen status tray. Mouse: No off/on button to save power but does have the means to turn it off by replacing the transmitter to the bottom of the mouse in a certain way!! Programming again possible via the support programme downloaded and installed on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: E2D Yah Soft

customer_reviews.title: For under 40, this is a good wireless combo
customer_reviews.text: I like ms keyboards and mice. I use them for however, especially their masse explorer optical mouse.l- those can last a long time and very durable. I chose this over logitech in the 40 price range mouse n keyboard combo and I think i made a good choice. I’m sure Logitech also makes good mouse n keyboard but I went with my instinct. Overall, it works as intended. Battery life rating I believe is abit below others but I think I can afford to reply batteries after 8months of usage
customer_reviews.author: tloppa

customer_reviews.title: No good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this. First I should say that I'm a gamer and you probably shouldn't buy this keyboard if you are. I ran into problems like holding a key down would release even though I had it depressed (presumably to save power). The mouse did not work smoothly, the pointer would lag and jump. The scroll wheel had no resistance which made it fairly useless and meant I constantly cause scrolling when I hadn't intended to. For more general use I found the keyboard action far too spongy for my tastes, but I still pine for the old fashioned mechanical switch keyboards that actually clicked.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use at a comfortable price!
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to replace my wireless desktop set, but I couldn't find the same model. I was very reluctant to get the ergonomic shape, since I'd never tried one, but my typing speed has dramatically with this keyboard - an unexpected benefit! One of my favorite things about the mouse, as with the previous model for this set, is the magnification button - my sight is not getting any better, and I use this constantly! Usually Microsoft products don't do as well with battery life compared to Logitech, but Logitech didn't have what I wanted at a price I could afford, so I'm fine with a few extra batteries along the way.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Nice keyboard set.
customer_reviews.text: I selected this set based on three criteria: 1) reasonable price 2) good reviews 3) I liked the feel of this one best after trying several others at a brick and mortar. Only issue I have with it is the lack of display to indicate caps lock is engaged. This is not needed if logging on to Windows but other areas that don’t tell you when your caps lock is on can be problematic at times. You don’t know if you’ve entered an incorrect password or not so wind up opening a text editor to type and see what’s going on.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: It lags in windows 10 sooo bad :(
customer_reviews.text: Do a little research and look at all the posts about it online. Both the mouse and the keyboard have a terrible lag. It saddens me to have to give this a bad review. This is my 5 Microsoft comfort keyboard and unfortunately probably my last. I have tried everything to resolve this issue and it always happens and I just cant stand it anymore. I am getting a logitec :( I gave it 2 stars because it seriously is my favorite keyboard and mouse combo when it works... but because it never works without lag now i should probably give it 1.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Tab key just stopped working...not possible to get support
customer_reviews.text: The tab key just stopped working..which makes the keyboard absolutely useless. I love this keyboard. It is my second one. I have tried for an hour to contact support, or even find an email to ask for the warranty...nothing. Just the online run-around asking to input things just to not find my product and back to where I started. Microsoft is just too big to support anything other than windows. Back to logitech I guess.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: I have had this keyboard since June of 2017. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard since June of 2017. I am a transcriber and, therefore, am very hard on my keyboards. I have never had to replace a Microsoft keyboard due to it breaking - just have to replace them because the letters wear off. I have purchased the stickers to put on them, but again, they don't last very long. I've always ordered the Microsoft keyboard, but am definitely going to reconsider. Spending over $50 every couple of years on a keyboard because the letters come off is not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: wendy r.

customer_reviews.title: Letters wear off easily
customer_reviews.text: First of all I will say this is the best keyboard I have every used. This is now my 4th one. However the mouse is nothing to brag about and do not use it. The reason I have to keep replacing is the letters on the keys wears off. I just replaced the one I had for almost a year that had not hardly a single letter left. Now after only one month of use this one is already wearing off. The I O and E are completely gone. Sadly this will be my last purchase of a Microsoft keyboard. I will just have to go on the hunt for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: GLK Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I started doing transcription work from home and it was suggested to get an ergonomic keyboard. I purchased this one. The first one was great however the keyboard went a little haywire on me. I have a laptop and wanted to use the keyboard just when I was transcribing. It kept sending signals to my laptop and it was not working well when I was using it. Amazon replaced it with a new one and I have had no issues since. The keyboard comes with a mouse. Great keyboard and it is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Arrowood

customer_reviews.title: unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: This is the second keyboard of this kind I purchased wanting the ergonomic feature. I had trouble with the keys not communicating with the computer. I purchased a new one with the same results. I actually had a ticket in to return, but it started working. Just as my return window ended it stopped again. I was so frustrated trying to figure out why it would just stop responding. I finally purchased a completely different product and love it, but now have this keyboard to discard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super good!
customer_reviews.text: My sister had this one at her office. I used it for a bit and realized it was what I needed. It's comfortable and ergonomic, and yet the buttons between the QWERTY and the numeric keyboard are in the regular order (you'd be surprised to see how many of the ergonomic keyboards have different setups). I'm very used to this setup and I use all of those keys quite a bit, so this was important to me. The quick access keys are very useful. I love that there's a button for the calculator! Overall, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Good value. Ok feel.
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for a better tactile feel. The keystroke is deeper and could feel better/be quieter. Spacebar got the shaft and is the noisiest. Sometimes there is a delay if not complete interruption of signal out of the blue. Still, it feels better and more solid than Logitech IMHO. The mouse wheel is silky smooth without clicks which I like so hope it’s durable. The shape is blah- like an egg that’s flat on the bottom. They could have done a better job. The USB receiver is really large- Logitech wins hands down on that.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: It just decided to stop working
customer_reviews.text: I have had many Microsoft keyboards and have really liked them. Bought this one, hooked it up worked fine until about 4 weeks ago and it just decided to stop working. Changed the batteries, tried everything and it still will not work! Of course, it is to late to return so now I am out the money it cost and I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Harley G'ma

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The configuration and dynamics of the keyboard on my laptop are not comfortable for me to use. I am more generally accustomed to using a desktop, which makes transition to the laptop keyboard uncomfortable. The ergonomic curvature of the wireless keyboard is even more comfortable for me than my desktop straight keyboard. Have had absolutely no difficulty or problems with the keyboard or the mouse...even though I have managed to drop the mouse several times to the point where the batteries came out. Battery life on both has been consistently reliable thus far. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PickyShopper65

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase!:)
customer_reviews.text: I ‘m very happy with my purchase.. What a difference! No more multiple entangled wires from my old mouse and keyboard. This keyboard is very comfortable with wide handrest.. the Wireless mouse worKs consistently unlike some other brands I have used before. One minor issue though, the “ insert” tab isnt working but since i dont use that key often, it doesnt bother me.
customer_reviews.author: snowbird

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use my p/c about 3 hours daily for business and personal use. This replaces the standard keyboard that came with my Dell desktop. The batteries in the mouse need to be changed monthly whereas the keyboard has lasted 3+ months without needing new batteries. The USB antenna plugged into the back of p/c has intermittent delays whereas no problem when it is plugged into the front of the p/c.
customer_reviews.author: Fred in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Wheel Falls Apart After Less Than 1 Year of Use
customer_reviews.text: The rubber on the mouse wheel completely denigrated after less than a year of use. You can see where the rubber entirely came off and left small rubber "gunk" between the wheel. Definitely a product issue. When I tried to file a claim under the Microsoft product warranty (which covers 2 years from date of purchase), Microsoft support gave me the runaround, said this has to be dealt with via Amazon (not true, only within the return period of Amazon), and made me call back 5 times as my call was repeatedly dropped when transferring me between departments. Finally, they said unless this is damaged upon receipt, they will not provide a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Buckley

customer_reviews.title: I like the ergonomic feel
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, both pieces seem to lose connection with the tab that goes into the computer. I had to put it in the usb connect in the front of the computer, as they won't work if I place it where it should be in the back. Also, I cannot have anything between the tab and the keyboard/mouse, so I cannot place my keyboard on the desk - have to put it in my lap and directly face the pc tower. I like the ergonomic feel, and when it isn't blocked it works nicely. I think they could work on this one a little to make a stronger wireless connect.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two )one for home and one for office) to replace the exact mason I’ve had for 10+ years. I’ve tried other similar models but this is the best by far. Very comfortable and works great. Batteries last forever and is plug and play. Highly recommend. I won’t use anything else as long as these are still around (I had a hard time finding this exact one).
customer_reviews.author: James C. Guy

customer_reviews.title: The letters are coming off the keys
customer_reviews.text: I noticed the character "C" no longer had a top and the "o" between the I and P is completely gone. What good is a keyboard if the letters rub off after 9 months of use? I have not used any special cleaners on the keys, only a fiber cloth and some compressed air to key the keyboard clean. Very disappointed with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Holloway

customer_reviews.title: I think this seller meant to sell on Ebay.........not on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: 1) This item came with batteries already installed (and dead!) 2) The key covering plastic was missing from the mouse and keyboard 3) The keyboard has grease marks on the resting wrist portion of keyboard 4) The mouse wasn't even wrapped in plastic when it was received 5) The Enter button isn't reacting when pressed 50% of the time Selling a "used" item as a "new", that's what Ebay is for, not Amazon! This is just bad business practice and filing a complaint. BTW, I love this MS keyboard/mouse set and I've owned over 4 of sets for the past 6 years and it's by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: K. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good kdb but probably not for software development
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard-mouse combo enough to be on my second one. The first lasted well until a coffee spill that hit both the keyboard and the mouse. The single receiver works well although I don't believe that there is any security to it. There keys have full travel and a slight but helpful detent. The mouse also works very well. My only complaint is that the escape key is too small, and lower than the adjacent, and also small, function keys. To press it one has to use the point of their finger. That would make sense for a reset button or something, but why on the escape key ?
customer_reviews.author: Clueless

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard design paired with internal components that seem to be utter garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable keyboard. Egronomics of the keyboard are 5 star, however that is where the good news ends. The USB receiver dongle goes unresponsive pretty regularly and must be unplugged a re-inserted to get it to function again. This reoccurs regularly; from every 30 minutes to every handful of hours. Also, I didn't like the shape of the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: N. Black

customer_reviews.title: The key board is great but the mouse won't work with the excel 2013 ...
customer_reviews.text: The key board is great but the mouse won't work with the excel 2013 software which is the main program for my estate planning business. This is very inconvenient... I'm a very busy person and this is costing me time I don't have. Because the is a combined keyboard and mouse item... I have to return both even though the keyboard is fine. Support had no idea why it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA EADER

customer_reviews.title: Warning: May not work on newer Mac OS X releases
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I just loved the Comfort Curve 2000 keyboards, but those are no longer available. We ordered this one as it appeared to be close to the 2000's layout, and was reported to have Mac OS X support. But, it appears that Microsoft has chosen to not continue support for newer OS X releases, and this keyboard and mouse would not work with OS X 10.11 (El Capitan). Given the problems I have experienced with Sierra having even more HW compatibility issues, I would not recommend this keyboard for anyone running a newer version of OS X
customer_reviews.author: K. W. Rudd

customer_reviews.title: Initially dropped connections, but now works great
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an existing Desktop 5000 system where the mouse scroll wheel had problems after years of use. Initially I was having some issues with the mouse (& keyboard?) not always talking to the PC (intermittent stalls in mouse movement). This may have been interference with some other wireless device such as wireless internet? However after some other driver upgrades over the course of a couple months, I have a continual connection to the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works great, nice design, good solid feel
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse and keyboard combo (Microsoft has always paid good attention to their keyboard and mice hardware)., and have made this combo my standard for both work and home use, and give them to my grown children as well. If I really wanted to see how well they'd last, I'd give one to "share" between the 6 and 2-year old grandkids, but that would be a bit unfair to Msoft.
customer_reviews.author: F. McNally

customer_reviews.title: Mouse is awful; F keys too small, otherwise okay, but I'm replacing it ASAP.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is uncomfortably large and the wheel doesn't have enough resistance, so it feels like there is inadequate control of the cursor. The "F" keys on the keyboard are too small and require focus and attention to push them. Don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kit fox

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, very easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot yet say about battery life or durability. But installation was extremely easy, just plug the little USB transmitter to the computer, press a couple of buttons for the keyboard to be identified, and it works. I like the feel of the keyboard keys, they're relatively soft, and the keys do not protrude too much (unlike a similar Logitech wireless keyboard I have, which has keys that require more effort to press). The pad for the palms at the front of the keyboard is comfortable, and has squared grooves to make it less slippery. The mouse is also quite robust, with a full feel of the hand over it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharoni Shafir

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but key letters wore off
customer_reviews.text: Letters wore off of several of the keys after 12 months use. Tried to get warranty service but M$ says this is "normal", go buy "key labels". The keyboard is ergonomic and comfortable to use, though Escape key is small as are the rest of the function keys. The mouse is full sized, unlike competitor products in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard so much, I ordered one for my home office also. The only issue is I do have to replace the work keyboard every year+ though - the common key letters eventually rub off. I wish the letters were depressed in the key a bit instead of being printed on top. If you aren't typing a lot every day, it won't matter as much.
customer_reviews.author: CO Jen

customer_reviews.title: Laggy and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Laggy and unreliable. Big disappointment. The keyboard is laggy. Often pressed keys are not reacting for seconds Same goes with the mouse: sometimes it jumps half a screen at once making accurate clicks very difficult. Even if I like the ergonomics, the system is unusable for me and I have to return it Back to the old wired mouse and keyboard, until I identify a better solution.
customer_reviews.author: Ultima Gaina

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the batteries with brand new ones and still, It will randomly lag, and other times, randomly disconnects. You know when it happens because you can hear the audible disconnect noise from the computer like you removed the USB dongle. Other times, the mouse or keyboard will just stop responding for a moment or five. his is what I get when I try to type out a comm sentenceeSome of the key strokes are registered and some of them are blatantly ignored. It's very frustrating, esecially when you're typing a long paper and type quickl
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: ★★★★★  Just plug it in and is ready to go. Comfortable RECOMMENDED A+++++ ★★★★★
customer_reviews.text: We use these exclusively here at the office and always keep a spare just in case we wear one out. We have been using this one for years and it is comfortable on the wrist and arms, easy to use. Just plug it in and is ready to go. ★★★★★ HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ★★★★★ 5 Stars A++ 👑 VOTE thumbs UP IF YOU FOUND THIS HELPFUL 👑
customer_reviews.author: DaPoppa1

customer_reviews.title: key sizes varying depending on how fingers typically "reach" for keys
customer_reviews.text: I have a shift key sticking, but seems to get better the more I use it. Other than that, I like it. You'll notice with some keyboards, all of the keys are exactly the same size and shape. But with this keyboard, the key sizes varying depending on how fingers typically "reach" for keys. For example the B and N keys are larger to make it easier for the user to hit them ... some keys need to be a larger target, and this keyboard is designed for that.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck M.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not innovative
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is exactly what I wanted to replace an older version, but come on Microsoft, included a simple on/off switch to save battery life! I find the mouse too large for my hand, so I continue to use my Tecknet, which I bought from Amazon. It has an on/off switch and powers down when inactive.I had to search a bit to find the correct driver and instructions, and would like clearer instructions for keyboard macros--it seems they could be helpful if only I could get them to work.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Wireless Comfort Desktop 5050 - It's OK, But...
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on leaving your laptop in one place (which is unlikely; it's a laptop...You got it so you could move around, right?) then think hard about buying this wireless set from Microsoft. Pros: Sturdy, comfortable, adaptable (with smart key that you can program), and attractive Cons: If you loose the USB receiver, then God help you (because Microsoft sure as heck won't). They don't sell receivers alone, and there's no universal replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MajRob

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this keyboard. I liked the wired comfort 3000 a lot and was forced to try this one when the 3000 broke. I was annoyed that I had to buy a wireless. It does not have any lights other than to tell you that it is on, and that light only worked for a few seconds. I don't like the GIANT wrist rest. And I also didn't like the mouse. It was too wide and hurt my hand. I sent this back and got the Microsoft Wired 600, and I love that one. Only $17, too.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Murphy

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after 3-4 weeks :(.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set up for my home office. However, I used it for about 3 weeks and then it would have “freezing” moments where it wouldn’t work. Then it would come back. Then after a couple of days of that my computer wouldn’t recognize it. Said there was a problem with the device. I thought it was my computer so I tried two other computers. Same issue. I wanted to return the item but I had only few days to return it (30 days from purchase I believe) but traveling for work, I couldn’t make it happen. Needless to say, I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stonebraker

customer_reviews.title: Best work keyboard on the planet
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft really got their shift together on this one. I had this keyboard at my old job, because it came with the work station. After I quit, I realized how convenient this thing was especially the"right click" button on the keyboard. You'd be surprised how many keyboards don't have this one button. And not to mention it's soft. It's hard to describe. Long story short, I own 3 of these now just because. I heard best buy still carries these of you wanna test out the feel.
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard - bad mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, very comfortable to use throughout the day, but the mouse is a different story. The scrolling wheel on the mouse is awful. It's not smooth at all and is very jumpy. I've changed the batteries, uninstalled and re-installed the drivers, and have done a complete reboot with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fancy keys not really helpful
customer_reviews.text: Product was fine. Gave it a four out of 5 because no useful user's / product' guide on how to program keys either in the box or anything useful on the internet. I also feel that a number of keys are too small such as 'enter' and 'delete'. Make sure you take a good look at the keys for the ones you use a lot and their relative size before you purchase. Having said that I am generally pleased since I don't use any of the keys at the top of the keyboard as most did not actually do anything.
customer_reviews.author: Dana A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Less than 3 months and the keys are sticking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the keyboard in May and experiencing horrible problem with the keys sticking (somehow) without holding any keys down keyboard. It's like I have a ghost touching my keyboard. I replaced the batteries twice, random keys still sticking. On top of all this, the "warranty" through the buyer/Amazon was only 30 days,. That's a joke. Now I have to go buy ANOTHER keyboard. Should have just stuck with buying one at Office Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mouse does not recognize when using KVM switch.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set to use only one transmitter for mouse and keyboard for KVM switch for two computers. Keyboard no problem, mouse would not recognize. plugged into one computer worked fine, plugged into another computer worked just fine, then plugged back into the KVM switch and nope, keyboard worked and mouse did not, even tried both usb ports on KVM switch. Like the keyboard, so just plugged my travel mouse into KVM and I am set for now. Not worth returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard/mouse duo for about a month and I LOVE LOVE LOVE it! The keyboard smiling at me fits my hands perfectly! I make very few typing errors, as long as I know what I'm typing :) ! The mouse fits my had perfectly and I LOVE the roller left and right motion and that it doesn't click, click, click like my old one! Also, the fact that the 'N' key is a different size than the 'M' key makes it so easy for me to hunt & peck over a cat sitting on my lap! I don't mistake them anymore!
customer_reviews.author: SuzanneK

customer_reviews.title: Good finish, little pricey, but if you like it it's well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. I don't generally like Microsoft keyboards (at all), but my Dad does and he really likes it. He's slightly arthritic and in his 70's...and he probably has a point here. It is comfortable, just not for me. But he can REALLY knock out WPM (between 70-90) last we checked, and says this is his favorite model so far. And I won't argue.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Service.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this fast. The "A" was broken on my other one and,,,,,you can't make whole paragraphs without using the "A". I chose standard shipping, figuring I'd just Netflix for a few days since I couldn't type. It came the NEXT DAY!!! Less than 24 hours after I ordered it...and again, this was standard shipping. Wow! And Yay!! Its very nice, quiet, comfortable. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mary

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I have this keyboard at work and I love it so much that I decided to buy one for personal home use. I use to have the Logitech MK550 ergo curved keyboard, but the entire keyboard is a little too widespread for my shoulders and both hands, making it harder to type. I love the built-in palm rest of the keyboard. This is a great in-between keyboard that's just slightly curved enough to be ergonomic, but not insanely curved like the Logitech MK550.
customer_reviews.author: NotThatMumboJumbo

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to keyboards, I may be the pickiest person on earth. I've thrown out more keyboards than most neighborhoods. I used to use the fabled IBM Model M but it makes so much noise that people wondered what all that noise was in the background when I was using my headset and typing at the same time. After using gaming keyboards with Cherry switches and assorted other high-end products, I finally realized that Microsoft at least for me, makes the best products. I previously had two Model 6000 Microsoft keyboards, but alas they don't make those anymore. This one is a good substitute. So I bought three.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey guy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't register keypresses sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product hoping that it would be a good replacement for my aging Comfort Curve 2000. Unfortunately, it is not. The mouse is uncomfortable, and the keys of the keyboard feel a bit soft or spongy. I'm sure one could grow accustomed to them, and I might make an effort to do so, but the keyboard doesn't appear to work properly. It frequently doesn't register key presses, sometimes missing them three or four times in a row. I'm not sure whether it's the wireless receiver, if there is some kind of interference, or if the keyboard itself is bad. But I don't have the patience to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Keys do not stick when keying and soft touch.
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for work. It is very easy to set up and use. Soft touch keys that do not stick when keying. I am unsure about the battery life as I just received this 3 days ago but i would assume it would be very similar to other keyboards at 6 to 12 months on the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Penny N

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard and Mouse - Highly Customizable
customer_reviews.text: I love my keyboard and mouse. Helped with my wrist pain. The keyboard and mouse are highly customizable with the option to add numerous macros to both the mouse and keyboard. This makes my job so much easier and I would be lost without this mouse and keyboard. Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keys are relatively firm but with distinct and easy feel, the arc of the keyboard is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this keyboard and its predecessor for almost 10 years now (actually 4 different keyboards). Keys are relatively firm but with distinct and easy feel, the arc of the keyboard is a nice compromise between the straight board and "flying wing" split boards. Wireless works well. I don't like the mouse feel that much so I have a mini logitech as well, but the MS mouse works quite well
customer_reviews.author: Novasystems

customer_reviews.title: OK for light/casual use
customer_reviews.text: Good range and comfort but ESC and FCN key row are reduced size in favor of the top row shortcut keys. Also I find that I have to fully press the key for it to register a keystroke. These issues make the setup OK for light/casual use but not heavy or business. I actually switched ended up switching back to Logitec after 3 weeks. Suggestion: Add on/off functionality on the keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL A. FORD

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a magnificent keyboard. It’s quiet, soft to touch and very comfortable. It bought it to cover my laptop keyboard since my palms keep hitting the touch pad. I type very fast and a lot, and this keyboard keeps up and is not loud when I’m typing. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Madtown

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this same keyboard from Microsoft for about 10 years. My old one had lots of wear and wanted to replace it. Still very comfortable and great wireless range. The price right now is awesome, about half price. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: James L Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ergonomic Keyboard but....
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another Microsoft bluetooth keyboard years ago that I loved. This wireless combo is very comfortable for typing on for extended periods and has alot of great features and keyboard commands. The only drawback is that there is no caps light! Despite this design flaw, I love everything else about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmina2007

customer_reviews.title: Wireless works well, keys stick on keyboard contstantly.
customer_reviews.text: Was quite pleased with the keyboard until the delete and arrow down key began sticking just days after first use causing deletion of items on my computer I did not intend to delete. Not satisfied at all. Update: there is not a way to send keyboard back to company without calling a foreign number in the package to Microsoft. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger W

customer_reviews.title: Working fine, good touch on keyboard, but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This is even better than the 5000 keyboard. I saw many negative reviews saying it didn't work out of the box. But I've had this set for a couple of weeks now, and haven't had a problem. After 4 years of use I wore out the 5000 keyboard and the rubber roller on the mouse, and the touch on this one is even better. I'm now a year and a half later, and the mouse just quit working. No help from new batteries. Now I'm trying to figure out how to work with the warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. Gjundjek

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomics, Poor wireless performance
customer_reviews.text: I love the microsoft curved keyboards. they fit me better than the logitechs. But this has bad bluetooth. I had to get a USB extension and place the BT dongle very close to the keyboard and mouse or it missing strokes and mouse motion. I'm still using it and still being frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lee

customer_reviews.title: I love the 'wave' style keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a replacement kb/mouse set for my 10 year old set that just can't keep up anymore. This feels great and works great. My old one had padding on the wrist rest area and this one doesn't. That took a bit getting used to....so the comfort isn't as good as my other...but wave kb are not easy to find in a decent price range.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Frace

customer_reviews.title: Great Design,  Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: I had a wireless, Microsoft keyboard and mouse combo for about 8 years that held up like a champ (until I dropped it and broke the space bar). Without research or second guessing myself. I assumed the replacement would be just as great or better. I've had this keyboard for less than 3 months and have replaced the batteries in the mouse and keyboard five times. FIVE TIMES. So frustrating. The mouse is not responsive or accurate, I'm really disappointed with the product. I do like the adjustable keyboard, the texture of the wrist rest and the ergonomic design of the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Casandra Griffin

customer_reviews.title: arrow keys not working  after 4 1/2 months
customer_reviews.text: I really prefer this keyboard and mouse to other models. The mouse has programmable buttons on the side which I like. I bought this one on June 14 and yesterday the arrow keys stopped working. I use them a fair amount so this is highly inconvenient. I'm very disappointed. I"ve cleaned the keyboard, removed the keycaps and used canned air - nothing helps.
customer_reviews.author: SJW

customer_reviews.title: ... is my very first ergonomic keyboard ever and I love it! It's going to take a little time ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first ergonomic keyboard ever and I love it! It's going to take a little time to get used to the keys. But I'm sure I will adjust. It's quiet, and soft on my nails. Another thing I love about this is the removable "legs" I think I may be the only person that puts it on the other side so the wrist part is the one that is elevated. I love love love the mouse! It's so big and sturdy. I have small hands, but I really appreciate the size of the mouse. It doesn't feel so flimsy. Best design for the keyboard and mouse!! Thank you Microsoft!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic value, value for cost, reliability, simplicity of use, expanded keyboard features, etc.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I like the fact that I bought this from Amazon at quite a savings compared to my local store. Keyboard and mouse operate using only one USB port, Good!! The ergonomic layout of the keyboard is just about right for me. Operates great right out of the box. Looks good. The mouse is a pleasing handful. Overall, the desktop 5050 is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for adjustable/Stand-up desks
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my previous MS wireless keyboard that I had so long that the letters had come off every key. Works great, has useful function keys and the shape fits well on my Ergotron stand-up/adjustable computer stand. I like the sound of the key clicks, the shape and the palm rest. Mouse is just right, too. I can sit across the room and it works great. Perfect keyboard for adjustable desks since you can go up and down without any wire snags.
customer_reviews.author: Vdub

customer_reviews.title: Weird Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up. There is no mention of this in the description but all the keys are not the same size. JHG are bigger than the rest and the others get smaller as you move out on the keyboard. I returned it as I couldn't type anything correctly.
customer_reviews.author: WinU

customer_reviews.title: This refurbished product didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I generally have had good experiences when it comes to buying refurbished products through Amazon. But I was a miss this time. When I plugged in the transceiver, the mouse and the keyboard got detected momentarily and stopped functioning. The behavior was identical on windows 10 and ubuntu 16.04. I had made sure that I use new batteries. I would assume that probably the transceiver is the culprit.
customer_reviews.author: vinay p

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a year
customer_reviews.text: It's a good comfortable keyboard for me, but it didn't last a year. I about it on August 6, 2018 and today, April 2, 2019 it broke down. I had previously had another one of these that lasted 3-4 years that I became comfortable with (hence I purchased this replacement) and I am surprised it broke down so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Keys become illegible
customer_reviews.text: I really like the comfort and battery life of this combo, but the most used keys (E, O, S, D) are now illegible (started wearing off around 3 months now those keys are pretty much unlabeled). I've only had Logitech keyboards before this and never had this problem at 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Willjacq

customer_reviews.title: Good all a round keyboard / mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: Good all a round keyboard / mouse combo. Reasonable price. 1 star off for occasional (rare) connection issues usually resolved by unplugging dongle and re-plugging to reset. May have local RF interference issues. Just enough to be irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Kona Mike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and practical
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these (office/home). I think it is very comfortable without the bulkiness of a true ergonomic keyboard. It is very adjustable in tilt (can tilt forward, slope backwards or be flat). The slight wave in keys is very comfortable on the wrists.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for iMac
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my iMac and it never worked correctly. Sometimes it would type and others you would have about 10 of the same letter on the screen. I bought my first one of these for another computer and it worked great! I will not purchase another Microsoft product for a desktop at this point.
customer_reviews.author: J. Feralin

customer_reviews.title: but the keyboard and mouse have been working great. The only complaint I have is that the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit leery because of past experience with intermittent working of wireless devices, but the keyboard and mouse have been working great. The only complaint I have is that the row of function keys (row with the escape) does not sit as high as the other keys in front of it so I have to make a more exaggerated movement to reach over the row in front to reach those keys. May just take some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: MandMLawson

customer_reviews.title: Should have believed the reviews, this is not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard failed, and Microsoft warranty is really difficult to work with. Right now the shift-1 operation doesn't give an !, and shift often fails for other keys. Also, the keyboard prevents the laptop from going to sleep. Only when I pull the wireless connection out of the usb slot can I get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Function keys are small - no caps lock light - everything else is terrific
customer_reviews.text: I really like this but there are two things that bothers me ....... if you use any of the function keys, they are very small and quite difficult to use. I use the function keys on a daily basis and I catch myself grumbling. The other downside, it needs to have a caps lock light. The rest of the keyboard, I LOVE IT! I have used so many various keyboards to find one that I can type with ease and help to eliminate discomfort from carpal tunnel. This keyboard is perfect. I gave the mouse that came with the keyboard to one of my kids and purchased a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewed by Me

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft messed up
customer_reviews.text: Uh Oh! Microsoft messed up this time! Keys stick! Some keys print multiple times with one light keystroke and some keys don't print at all (and I am an experienced typist!). Would return it if they would let me but they won't sooo (see that example), I've ordered a Logitech and will ditch this one.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Jones

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be especially bad when lots of programs are running
customer_reviews.text: A major letdown. The keyboard drops letters. The mouse misses clicks. I'm constantly having to fix mistakes because it can't keep up. It seems to be especially bad when lots of programs are running, and I've noticed it got even worse once I started using Office 365/OneDrive. I've already gone back to my old plugged in mouse, and am using the keyboard only until I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: The Eggplant King

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Huge difference in my typing and posture. My arms don't crowd my body and I'm not bending my wrists in a weird angle anymore. Feels very natural and it took maybe 2 minutes to get used to it. Will never go back to a normal keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's flat, not bulky, connected right away, and is SO much more comfortable than a standard keyboard if you do a lot of typing. Being wireless means you're not constantly tugging at cords that can be accidently disconnected when you move the keyboard, and you have more freedom to position it where you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Teri W

customer_reviews.title: Mouse has horrible resolution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard mouse combo to replace a wireless Logitech that was not reading keyboard inputs. The keyboard worked well, but the mouse would not register fine, slow movements. I feel like I can't win and may have to go back to wired input devices.
customer_reviews.author: J. Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: A Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Paired right away with my Windows 10 computer. I wanted a wave-style keyboard, and this was the closest I found. It's not as, "Wavey," as my old Microsoft keyboard, but it'll do. It's been in use for about six months, and it is still on the first set of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D.

product_meta.title: Microsoft Wireless Comfort Desktop 5050 (PP4-00001)
product_meta.description: This beautiful, ergonomist approved curved keyboard encourages you to use a more natural posture that aligns your arms, wrists, and hands for greater comfort. With a reliable wireless connection, you can eliminate clutter and work from anywhere in the room up to 30 feet away. Customize Taskbar Favorites on the keyboard and the buttons on the mouse for quick access to the programs, files, media, and webpages that you use most often. Plus, enjoy Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) technology, which is designed to help protect your information by encrypting your keystrokes.
feature_bullets: Ergonomist Approved Comfort Curve Design ; Designed to fit your right or left hand
Built in palm rest helps support and straighten wrists and 4 AA alkaline battery
Wireless for increased freedom. System requirement is windows 10 / 8 / 7 and mac os x v10.4 – 10.7
Customizable shortcut keys to easily access your favorite programs
Works on virtually any surface with BlueTrack Technology
Ambidextrous design is suitable for use with either hand
